title: Latin America & the Caribbean : homicide rates 2017 , by country
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants for 22 number of Countrys.
Country El Salvador has the highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants and Chile has the lowest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants.
The lowest value at Country Chile is 14.37x times less than the highest value at El Salvador.
min_summary: This bar chart has 22 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in each Country on the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants for 22 number of Countrys.
Country El Salvador has the highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants and Chile has the lowest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants.
The lowest value at Country Chile is 14.37x times less than the highest value at El Salvador.
max_summary: This bar chart has 22 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in each Country on the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is appeared to be the highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
Second maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is found at Country Jamaica.
The minimum Country Chile has got 14.37 times less Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants than the maximum Country El Salvador.
Country El Salvador is higher than any other Countrys with value 61.8, followed by Jamaica, and Honduras. Down to Country Chile with the lowest value 4.3.
Considered together, the average Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in all 22 Countrys is roughly 20.79.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 457.4.
